inn1.comm: Mashrafe starts with a length ball on middle and leg, defended from the crease to the off side by Gayle
angling away outside off, Gayle won't be chasing those at this stage of the innings

full and close to the off stump, a superbly timed drive from Gayle past extra cover, Razzak gives chase, long chase for him, but he catches up just in time, or does he? his boot slips just as he bends to drag the ball back and his foot touches the rope, so no runs saved for his effort
short of length ball outside off, Gayle lifts the bat over his head as he allows the ball through to the keeper
on off stump from Mashrafe, no exaggerated movement on offer so far, Gayle is slightly opened up by this delivery though as he blocks it away behind point
huge lbw appeal, umpire not interested, doubt over whether it pitched in line, might have been outside leg, also the height is in question, will we have an early referral? no, the DRS rests for now
short of length ball well outside off, Kirk Edwards defends just behind point
Edwards chases after a wide one outside off, no contact, umpire calls it a wide
short of length and angling in towards off stump, defended from the crease towards the bowler
slanting in towards middle and leg, Edwards shuffles across and taps it to the leg side
similar delivery, similar response, clipped to midwicket
on off stump this time, thick inside edge as Edwards looks to defend, ball dribbles in the direction of square leg

the off stump is cartwheeling there! Al amin has struck, Edwards didn't look comfortable at all in the middle, he won't have to spend any more time there, a short of length ball that cuts in to hit the top of off stump, not entirely sure what Edwards was doing there, no footwork as he tries to keep that delivery out, he can't, he's on his way
just outside off, Gayle confident to leave that one
pitched up and outside off, thick outside edge sends the ball flying through the vacant gully region
Darren Bravo opens the face of the bat as he blocks this length delivery towards point
on middle and off, solidly defended towards mid-off
blocked to the off side this time
full ball on the pads, pushed out towards mid-off to end the over
nice pace and bounce there for Al Amin, good line as well, just outside off, left alone by Gayle
pitched up, 130.7kph, on middle and leg stump, blocked to the leg side by Gayle
keeps it tight around off stump, 126.5kph, Gayle happy to shoulder arms
more watchful batting from Gayle, fuller one is pushed towards extra cover
angling across, passes just outside off, Gayle doesn't really start off in top gear these days, backing himself to make ground later on, he shoulders arms to this one
full and on the pads, clipped towards midwicket by Gayle
length ball heading for off stump, a stylish push sends the ball to mid-off, doesn't earn him any runs though
uppish drive as Bravo mistimes the drive, shouts of 'Catch it' but it lands well short of cover
Bravo looks to thrash that one through the off side, thick bottom edge and the ball bounces through towards the keeper
opens the face as he steers this one towards point from the crease
short of length and just outside off, dabbed down to third man to get off the mark, has taken him nine deliveries

Gayle has decided enough of the watchfulness, he charges down the ground a muscular flat-batted hit sends that soaring over the bowler's head and all the way over the rope, first six of the day, the power of Gayle on display there
short of length ball slants across, pushed in front of point
length ball on the pads, Bravo eases this wide of mid-on, and there is a rare quick single, West Indies need more of those and less of the dot balls
short of length ball on off and middle, pushed towards mid-on by Gayle

singles? who cares about singles? Gayle certainly doesn't, a tad short from Al Amin, at his pace, that is too easy to put away, especially for someone with the power of Gayle, who waits for it to arrive and dismisses it over midwicket
pitched up and around off stump, pushed towards mid-off
an outside edge, streaky boundary for Bravo, gets this one wide of first slip, there is no second slip, the ball rolls away to the third-man boundary
Mahmudullah starts with a full ball from round the wicket, defended down the pitch
spinning away that one, Gayle surprised by the bounce as well, manages to play it with soft hands, guides it past first slip
full ball darting towards the pads, solid forward defence
gets back in the crease and looks to defend, looking to make room but this one doesn't spin away, inside edge on to the pads
cramped by a full ball that is heading for middle and leg, defended
defended by Bravo as Mahmudullah finishes his first over, signs of assistance for the spinners
drops it a touch short, well outside off, chopped towards point
gets well forward and defends this one
on the shorter side once more, Gayle looks to thrash that through the off side, can't get it away past cover though
this time Gayle gets hold of it, again Gazi is short, sits up, Gayle shovels it away towards midwicket for four
not so short this time, but Gayle goes deep in the crease and laces this past extra cover for four, Gayle got his front leg well away from leg stump, giving him the room to swing the arms
this one doesn't spin away, Gayle gets an inside edge as he looks to play to the off side
drives this fuller one from Mahmudullah down to the man at long off
gets solidly behind the line of this one tossed up on middle and leg

that looked a good shout as Mahmudullah strikes Gayle on his front pad after the big Jamaican decided to go for a conventional sweep, but missed the ball entirely. However the umpire rules that this one was going down the leg side. They have gone up for the review and replays show that it was indeed a close shout. Would have been 'umpire's call' if they had opted for a review. Therefore the decision remains not out.
Gayle prods forward to keep out this latest offering from Mahmudullah
once again on the front foot to keep out Mahmudullah

tries to create room on the off side to cut away but almost succeeds in chopping onto his stumps as there simply wasn't enough space with the line bowled by Mahmudullah, which was going straight on in line of the off stump
cuts this wider delivery from Sohag away to the off side, but can't find the gap
leans forward into a drive as the fielder at short mid off is unable to hold onto it, with the ball bursting through finally to allow for the single
defends this one away to the off side
just eases this fuller one down to long on for an easy single
drifting on leg, Bravo gets forward and tucks it to midwicket
on the back foot to keep out Gazi to end the first set of Powerplay overs
bowls this slightly wide of off stump as Bravo is able to find the room to cut this away square off the wicket. The fielder coming in from deep cover is able to cut it off before the boundary
hangs back in the crease before pushing this one down to long off
simply nudged down by Gayle to the fielder at long on
driven authoritatively by Bravo to long off
Gayle able to take out the malice from this Gazi delivery as this is played away to the off side
on the back foot as he pushes this one to the fielder on the off side
Bravo looked to use his feet to try and work this away on the leg side, but doesn't quite get enough on it
this time finds room to cut away to the man at deep cover
Gayle didn't quite pick that one as this one stayed quite low upon pitching just outside off. Gayle manages to keep it out in the end
Gayle still on the back foot as this one is pushed away to long on
defended manfully by Bravo to this one sliding down the leg side
once again Bravo looks to cut outside off, but this one stays quite low as he is beaten in the end. Should have been on the front foot there.
Gayle defends this to the man at point
Gayle looking to get down the track before deciding to defend the ball away to the leg side
Gayle content on just defending this one away to the off side
gets forward again but just can't seem to get the ball away on the leg side
leaves his crease to drive this one to long off for a single
Bravo on the front foot as this one is driven to deep extra-cover
and he is greeted to the bowling crease with an emphatic short-arm pull from Bravo which is destined for the long on boundary
looks to go once more in the same region, lifting Nasir Hossain off the back foot, but doesn't quite get the timing on it as the man stationed at long on is able to cut it off
Gayle gets forward to defend this fuller one from Nasir
defends this one straight back to the bowler
gets forward a touch and punches it to long off
Bravo manages to just get this away behind square, but is lucky to evade the fielders nearby, as this ends up falling safely away. Manages to get a couple out of that
spearing slightly down the leg side as Gayle fails to get any bat on it as he looks to sweep this fine. Called a wide by the umpire
once again Gayle is struck in front, but this one is definitely sliding down
too full from Mahmudullah as Gayle picks his spot before clearing the boundary at cow corner for a huge six

what is this? Gayle has decided it is time to release some pent-up energy as he goes for yet another handsome blow, this time down the ground, to make it consecutive sixes. Will he make it a hat-trick?
this time decides to stay back and simply dab this one behind point
no run as he looks to go for the cut through the off side

Mahmudullah may have just got his man as he gets one to turn away upon pitching middle and leg, with Gayle on the back foot looking to pull this through midwicket, but ends up missing as the ball strikes his thigh pad, which looks in line with the stumps. The umpire gives it out initially, but West Indies go for the review and it does show that the ball did pitch outside marginally outside leg, so a good review there by the West indies.
fullish on off, Bravo blocks it with a straight bat
length ball going across the batsman as Bravo ends up chopping this behind square
angled this one on middle and leg, Bravo turns it to short midwicket
defended by Bravo off the back foot to the off side
Bravo on the back foot to this one pitched on middle and leg. Defended away to the leg side
short from Al-Amin and going across Bravo as he opens the face to guide this behind square to the man at sweeper cover for a single
fullish around off stump, Bravo gets forward and drives it to sweeper cover
bowls a leg cutter which Gayle gets forward to before opening the face slightly to try and guide it past the wide slip
this time looks to penetrate through extra-cover, but the fielder is up to the challenge
gets low to this one pitching just outside off as he is able to work it away on the off side for a quick single
in the slot for Bravo as he drives this one to sweeper cover for one
waits till the last moment before checking his shot to push this one down to mid off for a single
ends up playing this one back to the bowler

almost manages to get to his fifty with a very streaky shot as he is rushed by Al-Amin's pace to get an outside edge which beats the slips and almost goes to the third man boundary, but is reined in just in time
on the back foot straightaway as this is punched to mid off for one. Moves to 49
short of a length on middle and off as this is defended away off the back foot to the off side
this time targeting the pads as Bravo looks to whip this away behind square
this time bowls it wide outside off as Bravo is given the space to cut this away square off the wicket
full ball outside off, thumped towards short cover, where a diving stop is made, cracking shot from Bravo for no runs
short of length ball just outside off, steered towards backward point
short of length ball is guided down towards third man, and to most people's surprise the first run is sprinted, allowing time for a quick two
short of length ball is steered to third man once more, closer to the fielder so no time for two
pitched up and on the pads, 46th ODI half-century comes up for Gayle after he tucks the ball towards midwicket for an easy single
length ball angling away outside off, 128.3kph, defended towards extra cover, loud call of 'No' to indicate there is no quick single
slides on after pitching around off, defended down the track
short, much too short from Gazi, thank you says Gayle, murders that over midwicket. massive hit for six
ooh! inside edge this time, nearly goes on to the stumps,  towards short fine for a quick run
defended back towards the bowler
nicely done by Bravo, tucks this one towards square leg
defended towards mid-off this time by Gayle
a touch short, cracked towards backward point, can't find the gap
full ball just outside off, driven towards long-off for a single
full and outside off, squeezed towards deep point, runs coming easy for West Indies now
short of length ball on middle and leg, tapped towards extra cover
short of length and on the leg stump, pushed it towards mid-on
short of length and on the pads, pulled towards deep midwicket
full ball from round the stumps, eased towards point for a quick single

Gayle is gone! not the most threatening of deliveries from Mahmudullah, but it is good enough to get the big wicket, it was shortish ball that stayed a bit low, Gayle had loads of time to pick his spot and dispatch it, he picks out the man at deep midwicket though, Mahmudullah is elated, Gayle grins ruefully, knowing he has given it away
a touch short from over the wicket, Ramdin goes deep in the crease and chops it towards cover
length ball from round the wicket, a muted lbw appeal, but that likely pitched outside leg
on middle and leg, tucked towards square leg
worked to backward square leg with the turn for a single
Razzak finally into the attack, a muted lbw appeal first up but that slider was going down leg
driven towards long-off for a single
length ball outside off, opens the face to deflect the ball towards short third
length ball on middle, defended by Bravo
pitched up and outside off, Bravo decides to go for the cut though it isn't too short or too wide, bottom edges it towards point
spinning away outside off, Ramdin makes a bit of room and stabs this towards cover
fuller one turns in, Ramdin gets his bat down in time to keep that out
slapped towards deep point to bring up West Indies' 100
goes straight on outside off from round the wicket, guides it towards short third man
spinning in towards the pads, clipped towards deep midwicket
full and down the leg side, Mushfiqur is across to prevent any byes, Bravo wanted to put that away but doesn't connect

gets forward and drops the ball towards cover, Bravo sets off for a tight single, a direct hit could have been interesting, but there isn't on,e with Ramdin in instead of Gayle, there should be more quick runs
tucked to square leg for a single to end the over
pitched up and on the pads, swept by Ramdin at short fine leg, good diving stop there by Al-amin Hossain
shot! Darren Bravo skips down the track and lashes that over the bowler's head for six, what a stylish hit that was
there is a shout for lbw from Mushfiqur after the ball slides down the leg side, the umpire calls it a wide
length ball around off, guided to backward point for a tight single
length ball on middle and leg, solid forward defensive
looks to drive this length ball towards extra cover, inside edge towards mid-on instead
drops it short, flat-batted towards long-off for a single, West Indies 119 for 2 and looking good for a solid total
there's the cut from Ramdin once more, the ball was a touch short, Ramdn made the room, gets a single past point
length ball on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket for a single, plenty of those coming now for WI
drives this towards cover, thinks about a single but then shouts 'No'
spins in after Mahmudullah drops it short, helped towards square leg
full and down the led side, another free run for WI
full ball on middle and leg, defended down the track
pitched up and outside off, Bravo waits on the back foot and cracks that towards deep backward point
length ballon off stump, not much turn, careful defence off the front foot
spinning a bit away this time, Ramdin gets on the back foot and plays it towards sweeper cover
full toss is drilled towards long-on for a single
gets well forward to defend, keeps bat and pad close as he does
less compact from Ramdin, he looks to drive inside-out, thick inside-edge onto the pad
length ball well outside off, thrashed towards sweeper cover
drops it short, spinning in towards the batsman, who can't get the room to swing his arms, hit towards long-on for a single
gets forward and defends this one towards point
a bit of flight, on the pads this time, clipped towards square leg
full ball way outside off stump, sliced towards sweeper cover
spinning in towards middle, pushed towards midwicket
Ramdin backs away from the stumps, thumps the ball towards mid-on for one more
the cut shot once more from Ramdin, guides this one towards deep point, Ramdin sprints back for the second
length ball on middle and leg, defended off the front foot towards midwicket
bit early on the shot there, the ball nearly popped back to the bowler as the batsman drove
gets deep in the crease and sends the ball towards mid-on for a single
fifty comes up for Bravo, clips the ball towards midwicket to pinch the single, it is his 16th ODI fifty, just one hundred though, as a top-order batsman he needs to convert more
worked towards midwicket this time
steers the ball in front of point for a single
flighted delivery from Mahmudullah, swept away for a single
too wide from Mahmudullah, fairly short as well, slapped towards sweeper cover
dropped? no, byes says the umpire, then it is a missed stumping, Ramdin charges out of the crease and looks to slog that one but he misses it, Mushfiqur also misses it and Ramdin is reprieved
a muted lbw appeal but he was struck well outside off
Mahmudullah finishes off his spell, Bravo chops that one towards point
pitched up and that is driven back towards the bowler
gets well forward and defends, Razzak keeping it around off stump
length ball on off once more, not too much turn, Ramdin pushes it towards cover
flighted, fullish and on the pads, eased to long-on to bring up the 50-run stand
Bravo skips down the track, not quite near where the ball pitched, so he checks his shot, dabs the ball towards point instead
punched towards midwicket to end a tight over
Gazi bowls from wide of the crease, round the wicket, guided in front of point
slides on towards off and middle, tries to slap it off the back foot, can't get it past cover
once more finds the man at short cover
four dot balls in a row, forward defense this time
guides this one off the front foot behind point, it was full and flat from Gazi

huge lbw appeal, and Gazi has his reward after a tight over, the well-set Bravo is dismissed, it was an arm ball from Gazi, Bravo ends up playing down the wrong line, he was expecting the conventional offbreak, struck in line, Aleem Dar doesn't need much time to make up his mind, Bravo is on his way
Ramdin goes deep in the crease and punches the ball towards long-off
full ball on the pads, eased to mid-on for a quick single
heading for middle stump, a length ball is defended off the front foot
slapped in front of point for a single
flighted this time, gets forward to defend, an inside edge sends the ball towards midwicket
more forward defence to end the over
spinning in towards middle and leg, driven from the crease towards long-on
defended to the leg side this time

a run-out chance, that should have been a wicket, poor effort from Al Amin at mid-on, Simmons checked his shot to chip the ball over the bowler's head, Ramdin set off for the run, Simmons didn't, Ramdin has to turn back, Al amin has all three stumps to aim at and plenty of time, his throw is wild though, and Ramdin is safe
poked towards point for a single
defended this one to end the over
length ball spinning away, Simmons allows it through to the keeper
flighted by Razzak, length ball is worked towards midwicket for a single, Simmons starts running even as he plays the stroke, there is a direct hit but Simmons is in
Ramdin goes deep in the crease and cuts that away from off and middle stump
length ball on middle and leg, driven a touch too firmly towards mid-on, no time for the single
forward defensive from Simmons to a length ball just outside off
short of length ball outside off, blocked off the back foot, just nine runs in the last five overs, Bangladesh doing a good job of pulling things back before the Powerplay
starts off with a short one on middle and leg which Ramdin gets back to as he pulls this away to midwicket
shortish length outside off which Simmons is content to defend to the off side
back of a length outside off which Simmons, looking to push this away to the off side, ends up defending
once again afforded no space outside that off stump as the ball is played away again to the off side
Simmons looking to open the face and guide this behind square, but the length is just not there for it
fullish length outside off as Mortaza ends a good, tight over for Bangladesh
drifting on middle and leg, Ramdin gets down and sweeps it behind square
Ramdin gets forward and drives it to long off
quicker on middle and off, Simmons tucks it to the on-side
favouring that cut shot once more, but not enough room for this to be manouevered past the slip fielder
drifting on leg, Simmons leans forward and pushes it to the right of the bowler
ends the over with a gentle push down to long off to keep the strike

gets some inswing upon pitching as Simmons misses this one coming into him from outside off. The ball ends up striking him on the thigh pad, but was missing the stumps, despite the plea from Mortaza to the umpire
shifts his line outside off as Simmons is able to find the single on the off side to get Ramdin back on strike
too full and on the pads as Ramdin is able to clip this to the fielder at midwicket
Mortaza firing this one on a length on middle and leg as Simmons nudges this to the leg side off his hips for one
short of a length outside off as Ramdin just glides this down to fly slip
shortish length outside off which Simmons manages to dab to the man at backward point
defends this one which is pitched on middle and leg and straightening
gets slightly forward to this one tossed up on and around off stump
takes a step down the track before easing this to mid on for one
slightly short of length and outside off, Ramdin opens the face to guide it to short third man

this one a little short from Razzak as Ramdin quickly gets into position by clearing his front leg to paddle sweep this just in front of square for the first boundary in over 15 overs. Much needed one there for the West Indies
yorker ball on off, Ramdin gets back to cut then ends up getting his bat down in time to jam it to the off-side

overpitched from Al-Amin outside off as Simmons manages to get bat on ball as this one flies away through the slip region to the third man boundary. Another four for the West Indies, and they will need plenty of them now.
almost a carbon copy of the previous delivery, except this time the ball finds the fielder. Was looking to cut that away, and that too quite low outside the off stump

Al-Amin shows some bowling nous as he drops the pace on this delivery, bowling in the same channel as before. Simmons, who was looking increasingly fidgety outside that off stump, this time looks to blast the bowler down the ground, but only succeeds in getting a thick outside edge which carries to Mushfiqur, who takes a good, low catch

Al-Amin almost plucks another one as he gets this one to come in upon pitching just outside off, with Pollard late on it as he is struck on the pad, however Pollard's big stride down the pitch may have just saved him there. Bangladesh are also out of their reviews, so they didn't have any choice but to adhere to the umpire's call. This would have gone over the top anyways
length ball on off, Simmons defends it back to the bowler
length delivery on off, Simmons gets forward and defends it to point
eases this one to the man at midwicket for a single
on the back foot as this one straightens upon pitching on a middle and off line
Simmons stays on the back foot and punches to long-on
punched off the back foot by Simmons to the right of the bowler
and he finally manages that single down the ground to long on to get off strike
ends his ten-over spell with one that is played back to him by the batsman
is able to find some space just outside off to cut away behind square as backward point is slow on the take, which allows for the extra run
waits for this one to spin in to him before getting on the back foot to play away to the leg side
slightly faster delivery on the same line as Pollard is able to ease this away to mid on
Simmons gains some much-needed confidence as he slaps this away through mid off and extra-cover for a boundary. This one was asking to be punished
short and on the leg stump, Simmons pulls it through backward square leg
Pollard once again looking to whip this away leg side, but can't penetrate the field
and he starts off by bowling a low full toss which Simmons opens the face to guide down to third man
Pollard steps forward to clip this one through midwicket
fires this one just inside of the 'wide' line outside off as Simmons manages to squirt this away through the off side for a quick single
Al-Amin has been slightly predictable here as Pollard advances down the track to loft him through cow corner for a boundary, beating the fielder placed at deep midwicket to the rope
wide outside off stump, Pollard drills it along the ground to long off
Simmons tried to glance this good length delivery very fine, but only manages to edge to to short fine leg for one

tosses this one up on leg stump as Simmons paddles this one round the corner, immediately setting off for a tight single. Pollard just manages to get to the other end before the return throw, but it was awfully close
short delivery on the leg stump, Pollard pulls it to deep midwicket
Simmons advances and drives the flighted delivery to long on

time for some stand and deliver as Pollard launches himself on this one which is slightly short on middle and leg as Pollard gets into good position to short-arm pull this all the way for an 88m six over deep midwicket
fires this one down the leg side as the umpire calls a wide
manages to flick this one away on the leg side to midwicket
a nice lollipop offered here from Gazi, but Simmons is rude enough to find the fielder at deep backward square leg, rather than make the spinner pay
shimmies down the track to this length ball outside off as Simmons just smashes this through the line to find the deep extra-cover boundary. First really aggressive shot from the right-hander
Al-Amin shows some ingenuity with a slow ball outside off which Simmons is late on
low full toss which Simmons succeeds in only hitting it to the fielder at mid off
widish low full toss outside off stump, Pollard smashes it hard but hits on the bounce to long off
Simmons tries to be cheeky, opening the face of the bat to try and send one past short third man, but misses
another slower delivery outside off, except this time Simmons is able to make contact, but hits it straight back to the bowler..
offers a gentle, low full toss which Pollard whips away to deep midwicket
Simmons is able to ease this fuller one just outside leg to long on
Pollard steps out to the leg side to negate the line bowled by Gazi round the wicket, but can't get it past the field on the off side
driven hard along the ground to long on for one
full outside off stump, Pollard smashes it to cover
Simmons plays a rather extravagant flick behind square, but luckily this one falls short of the fielder at deep fine leg. Was looking to go over the ropes
and not the best of starts as he begins with a wide outside off

length ball on off which Simmons lifts through midwicket, looking to beat the two fielders placed near cow corner, but the man at long on is able to put in the dive to stop the ball from reaching the boundary
this time looks for the slap through extra-cover, but extra-cover moves over expertly to field the ball
easy as you like from Pollard as he doesn't seem to be at all rushed in picking this one going down the leg side and just flicking it deftly behind him to the fine leg boundary. So easy on the eyes

and it's all over as Pollard, looking for a big hit through long on, gets an under edge which spills behind onto his stumps, rearranging them much to his chagrin. Big wicket there for Bangladesh as this is the kind of situation Pollard would have loved to be around for.
straightaway he gets off the mark with a gentle dab to short third man
good length delivery angled in, punched to extra-cover
short of a length and angling away as Simmons is unable to get this away, with the ball ended up being hit back to the bowler

really ugly swipe from Simmons as he looked to dance down the track to slap Al-Amin through the covers, but ends up looking away in the process as this one is hit instead behind square on the off side. Still manages to eke out a single from that
good slower ball outside off which Bravo is not even in the time zone off as he looks to heave over the off side
this time Bravo manages to connect as he opens the face slightly to hit this behind square to beat the converging point fielder to the rope
fuller one on and around off which is driven firmly to mid off
length just outside off which Simmons gets up and under off, but not quite far enough as this falls just short of sweeper cover
length just outside off as Simmons is unable to get enough bat on it. He is looking quite frustrated out there as this innings comes to a close
looking to deposit Mortaza over long on, but the slower delivery has him swinging early for the fences

this time uses his feet to get to the pitch as he lifts this high and handsome over long on, but doesn't get the distance required as this falls into the waiting hands of Mahmudullah, who ends up taking a straightforward catch. Ends a miserable stay at the crease for Simmons, who never really had the kind of fluency he craved for.

this is just what the doctor ordered for Bangladesh as this time Bravo, looking to pull across the line of this shorter one outside off, ends up getting an outside edge which Mushfiqur snaps up gleefully. Mortaza on a hat-trick, and West Indies' hopes of quick runs looking rather grim
and Narine is able to successfully keep it out as he plays this one back to the bowler
fullish delivery on the leg stump which strikes the pads of Narine as they scamper the leg bye
what a hit from Narine! gets into position to rock back and pull this short ball over deep midwicket for a 77-metre six. Fantastic stuff!
didn't quite get hold of this one as Narine ends up hitting this away to mid on
fires in a yorker just outside off as Holder is unable to get under it, with the ball traveling behind to the keeper
shifts his line outside off as this one shapes away upon pitching. It was also a bit slow as Holder looked to blast this away over the off side
shortish length which Holder is all over as he pulls this one fiercely over backward square leg for another big six

into the blockhole again as Holder digs this one out towards mid on, with the pair running the first one hard as they come back for the second, which they are able to complete just in time of the throw

inn2.comm: Holder on the mark straightaway as Tamim is cramped for room
back of a length, just outside off, as Tamim punches this one off the back foot to the fielder stationed at silly mid off
looks for the extravagant drive through the covers, but doesn't quite get enough on it for it to motor through the field
Tamim is more than satisfied to allow this one through to the keeper
gets nicely on top of this steepler on middle and off, as Tamim fends it away to the off side

surprises him with the shorter ball which has Tamim reacting by playing a rather awkward looking pull shot over square leg. He is lucky not to find any fielders though as he was never in control of that shot
tries to glance this one off the pads, but finds Roach at backward square
length ball going across the batsman as Tamim flashes hard at it, but misses
once again opts to go for the glance, but the line has shifted more to middle and off. Tamim ends up bobbling it to the off side
much better from Rampaul as this one is right on the money on off stump. Tamim gets forward to defend
short on middle and leg as Tamim is not about to hold himself back, employing the pull to good effect to find the single through deep midwicket

good bounce and carry from Rampaul as he gets this one to rear maliciously off a length, with Anamul lucky not to get any bat on it as it rushes past the edge to the keeper. This one really took off from the pitch. What a ball to receive first up!
short ball going across the batsman as Tamim hangs his bat, almost following the path of the ball, but is lucky not to catch an outside edge as the ball carries to the keeper
too much on the hips this time as Tamim is able to nurdle this away behind square on the leg side
short of a length and coming into Anamul as he successfully keeps it out
lovely delivery from Holder outside off as this one climbs appreciably upon pitching, with Anamul defending just inside of the line as the ball rushes to the keeper
similar line and length, but this time Anamul is able to cover the line and get behind it
a touch fuller on the same line as Anamul works this away just to the left of backward point, but can't get the run required
tests him out with a shorter one which has Tamim weaving away. Signalled wide by the umpire
pitches it up just outside off as Tamim defends towards the direction of point
full and just outside off as Tamim punches this through mid off for a single
honing on the pads as this one is eased away to mid on for one
Tamim decides to give the charge, Rampaul sees him coming and follows him, Tamim is cramped for room, he can't free his arms, he ends up working it to midwicket

on the back foot straightaway to this short one from Rampaul as Tamim punches this just behind square on the off side, but Edwards is able to move deftly to his left to field the ball from backward point. Excellent stop there by Edwards
back of a length on off, Tamim hangs back and bunts it to cover

Anamul saw that one nice and early. Where did that come from? Gets into position quickly to pull this one well over deep midwicket for a six. The timing was spot on and he just hit that so fluidly too.

length delivery just outside off which tempts Anamul into going forward, as the ball hits the outside edge on the way to the keeper. What a response from Holder after that earlier six! Anamul is not satisfied however, and has gone for the review straightaway. Replays show that there was indeed a deviation upon going past the bat, with a slight sound there as well. The original decision is out, remember. After some careful deliberation, the on-field umpire confirms that the original decision stands, and Anamul has to go. It is a pity, as he would badly have wanted to build on his hundred from the previous match.
excellent line and length, going across the batsman, as Kayes shoulders arms
once again going across the batsman as Kayes removes his bat out of the way, with the ball carrying to the keeper
this time Kayes decides to have a go at it, but is woefully late on the ball
Kayes is livin la vida loca as he gets down on one knee in hopes of cover-driving Holder to the boundary, but misses the ball entirely...
just dismissed from Tamim's presence as he rocks back to pull Rampaul through midwicket for a boundary. Too wide from Rampaul I'm afraid
content to just defend this one off the back foot to the off side
shot from Tamim! this was right in the slot as Tamim leaned forward to go through the line of the ball and place this through the covers for another boundary
again in the same spot and Tamim punishes him, this one was a bit straighter from Holder, but Tamim was all over this as he scythed away through the covers
shifts his line a bit closer to Tamim, which does the trick as he is unable to free his arms to manufacture anything on the off side
finishes it off with a short of length ball on middle and leg which Tamim whips away to the leg side, but can't penetrate the inner ring
excellent line and length from Holder, pitched up just outside off, as this one is shouldered arms to
back of a length on middle and leg which is deflected away towards the off side
fires one wide outside off as Kayes is coaxed once more into unleashing the expansive drive through extra-cover, but is quite late on it

not sure what Kayes is trying here as he gets a little room to free his arms, slogging one over the off side as sweeper cover comes forward to field the ball. That one gets him off the mark though, so a huge relief for Kayes
Tamim more than content to get forward to defend this length ball on middle and leg

Tamim sees the line being short as he advances down the track to slap this through extra-cover, with the fielder cutting it off before the boundary. Manages to earn himself a brace there with that effort.
gets on top of this length ball as he defends away to the off side
once again on the back foot as this is deflected away by Kayes

Kayes' struggle finally comes to a close as Rampaul is able to tempt him to go after a shortish length ball delivered on middle and off, with Kayes taking the bait, pulling him to the leg side, but not quite getting the control on it as it spoons high in the air and over to deep square leg, where Simmons takes a simple catch. He was looking to get going, but this is really not how you go about it. Bangladesh two down, and West Indies will be sniffing for another.
a wicket fell? Tamim doesn't seem to mind as he pulls Rampaul off his hips to the deep square leg boundary, getting enough power on it to beat the dive from the fielder to the rope
punches this off the back foot and sets off immediately for a single as the ball makes it way to extra-cover
short of length and tucking into the batsman, Shamsur fends it off the back foot to the leg side
short of a length on the pads as Tamim works it away behind square with a glance
pitches this up just outside off as Shamsur gets on top of it to fend it away behind square on the off side
drops his length outside off as this one angles in a bit upon pitching, with Shamsur content to duck under it as it comes into him
Shamsur gets behind the line of this length ball on and around off quite comfortably
provides length just outside off but Shamsur is satisfied in withdrawing his bat as the ball carries through to the keeper
shortish length angling across the batsman as Shamsur is quickly into position to pull this away through deep square leg for a boundary. That one just sat up upon pitching and was begging to be hit.
straightaway on the money as Tamim prods forward to defend this length ball just outside off
back of a length just outside off, Tamim mistimes the punch down the wicket, Roach does well to bend down and stop the ball in his followthrough

overpitched and in the slot as Tamim gets nice low to drive this one crisply through extra-cover. It looks like it may have just reached the rope in time of the fielder's pick up, with replays confirming that it was indeed a boundary
length on the pads which Tamim tries to whip away on the leg side, but doesn't get enough bat on it to take it very far
fullish length, pitched just outside off. Shamsur gets forward quickly to defend
Roach strikes in his first over! fires in a short of a length ball outside off which has Shamsur going after it with a cut, but he ends up playing onto his wicket as he was a tad early in the shot.
this one angling into the batsman as Tamim is able to cover the line without too much issue
tests him with a bouncer which has Tamim checking his shot as he goes for the pull, but he still manages to pickup a single on the leg side
provides length just outside off, but Rahim cannot be coaxed into having a go
shifts his line a tad closer to Mushfiqur, who is able to cover the line quite easily
Mushfiqur greeted with a shortish length ball just outside off as he looks to fend this away on the off side
Mushfiqur on the front foot to defend this length ball coming into him from Holder
and he starts off with a gently tossed up delivery on off, Tamim presses forward and blocks it to the off side
delivers this one down the leg side, with it turning in, but can't trick the umpire into not calling this a wide
Tamim leans forward and turns it to midwicket
Tamim gets nice and low to defend this one attacking his leg stump line
gives this one plenty of air, Tamim comes half forward and drops it dead on the leg-side
drifts onto the pads, Tamim glances it straight to short fine leg
floated up on leg-stump, Tamim clips and picks out midwicket
fine stop by Roach off his own bowling, pitched up around off, Mushfiqur drives it to the left of the bowler, Roach bends down and saves some crucial runs for the team
gets into position quickly to drive this length ball just outside off behind square
honing in on the pads as Mushfiqur looks to whip this away
provides some width outside off which is enough for Mushfiqur to guide it down to short third man for one
short ball on a leg-stump line as Tamim swivels to pull this behind square, but doesn't get enough on it to beat the converging deep fine leg fielder
defends this back of a length delivery outside off to backward point, playing it with an angled bat
once again attacking the leg stump as Narine succeeds in almost bowling Tamim round his legs, with this one just bursting through, but evading the leg stump
Tamim finally succeeds in finding that single on the leg side, although this was a bit uppish as he looked to get it away
gets nice and low on the front foot to neutralise the threat of this latest Narine offering
Mushfiqur plays this with soft hands as he drives towards point, setting off for a tight single which the pair are able to complete in the end after the failed pickup from Pollard

fractionally short and a bit wide from Narine as Tamim cuts this away, again rather uppishly, with backward point putting in a dive to try and get to it, but the ball beats him and races to the third man boundary
slower and on off, Mushfiqur crouches low and works it to midwicket
back of a length around off, Tamim mistimes the pull to deep midwicket
reverts to the front foot as this one is eased to mid on, with Tamim urging Mushfiqur to go for the quick single, which they make in the end safely
drops it short and on leg stump, Tamim pulls it with one foot in the air to deep backward square leg
angling on the pads as this is glanced away by Mushfiqur to deep midwicket
short ball on leg stump which Tamim dabs down to third man for an easy single
short again from Roach as Mushfiqur deflects this away to the leg side to end the over
Narine's first ball is slapped towards cover by Tamim

Narine has struck! the Bangladesh captain is undone by the extra bounce, Mushfiqur was looking to chop that one through the off side, not much turn on that delivery, but fizzes off the pitch and rears up, top edge through to the keeper, Denesh Ramdin knows how big a wicket that is, he's off on a celebratory run, Bangladesh in deep trouble now

bowled 'im! Narine on a hat-trick, he had no luck in the first ODI, today things falling his way, this one doesn't get up much, stays low, too low for the struggling Mahmudullah, who looks to defend that offspinner but the ball sneaks through to crash into the stumps, Bangladesh have lost half their team already, perhaps they can take heart from the Ramdin-Pollard show two days ago
spins in from back of a length, defended comfortably towards short leg
stretches well forward and defends towards silly point
the legcutter from Narine, Nasir waits on the back foot for that one and awkwardly defends that to the off side

soft, soft dismissal there, Bangladesh have now lost Tamim and surely the match as well, this was a back of a length ball on leg stump, Tamim chips it off his thigh pad, straight to midwicket, bit of a leading edge there, that's their third wicket down in the previous six deliveries, no runs added, what did West Indies have for drinks?
back of a length ball heading for the off stump, defended from the crease
this one is defended towards cover off the front foot
goes for a flamboyant cut shot, this was back of a length and just outside off, rocking back and looking to thump that past point
punched off the back foot, mistimed and the ball rolls towards cover
full ball heading for offstump, pushed towards mid-on to end a wicket-maiden
gets forward and drives this length ball past silly point
defends off the front foot towards silly point
uppishly drive past a diving Gayle at midwicket, calls for a catch but that was just wide of the fielder
length ball spinning away outside off, a weak waft at that one, nowhere near the ball, Gazi doesn't seem to have much of a clue against Narine

there's the wicket, Gazi decided the best way to deal with Narine is to go for his shots, he attempts a big sweep to a pitched-up ball, only connects well enough to pick out Kirk Edwards at deep square leg, Bangladesh seven down
zips past the outside edge, the legcutter from Narine, the knuckle ball, too good for the tailenders
angling in towards middle and leg, defended to the leg side from within the crease
short of a length ball outside off, guided towards sweeper cover
bangs it in short, a gentle pull sends the ball towards deep backward square leg
on the shorter side once more, outside off, left alone by the batsman
outside edge and the ball dribbles towards third man for a single
short once more, outside off but that is awkwardly tucked towards midwicket for a single, Nasir will get to face Sunil Narine
spinning in towards off stump, defended off the back foot towards the bowler
another offspinner, turning towards middle, defended towards forward short leg
this one goes straighter, guided past backward point, Nasir sprints the first, wants another but there is no time
gets forward as he looks to defend that, nearly carries to forward short leg
spinning away, Mashrafe gets a good stride in as he blocks that to the off side
oooh! somehow Mashrafe isstill out there, the knuckle ball just turns a shade too much, it was quick and spun, just too much to hit off stump, Ramdin is amazed that ball missed the stumps
shortish ball is defended by Nasir

another one, Nasir's lean spell continues, Roach is dropping plenty short in this spell, Nasir looks to help that away towards midwicket, hits it well enough to make it a touch catch for Pollard, who leaps high to pluck that one, last 32 balls, 10 runs, five wickets, a sorry spectacle for Bangladesh fans at home who are staying up past midnight
looks to surprise the new batsman with a yorker, Razzak gets his bat down in time
now Roach serves up the bouncer, Razzak ducks under it in time
short of length ball on middle stump, Razzak gets behind the line and defends
just outside off, stays in the crease as he keeps that one out
'Catch it Pollard,' is the cry as the big man is at short leg, Mashrafe's defence nearly carries to him
forward defensive sends the ball past silly point
length ball spinning in from outside off, defended off the front foot
too short from Narine, the legspinner is spotted early, defended from the crease
quick offbreak, wrong line though, the ball spins down the leg side
solid forward defence this time from Mashrafe
'Catch him Simmo,' shouts Ramdin, once more Mashrafe's defensive push lands short of the close-in fielder, this time it is Simmons at silly point
Rampaul starts a new spell with a short of length ball outside off, defended to the off side
a bouncer to rest Razzak, who manages to get under that one
short of length ball just outside off, blocked comfortably to the off side
more defence towards the off side
a touch shorter and just outside off, blocked off the back foot by Razzak
pitched up, looks to drive though the covers but he misses and the ball whizzes past the outside edge, Rampaul looks up to the (blue) skies wondering why Razzak didn't edge that
pitching that legspinner on middle and leg stump, solid defended by Mashrafe
on the pads, tucked towards deep backward square leg
a big offspinner, drops it too short though and it turns away way outside off
quick leg break from Narine, Razzak manages to get the blade down in time to swat it away
defended off the front foot by Razzak
again a touch short from Narine, plenty of turn away, Razzak chases it and misses
spinning down the leg side, Narine seems to be striving a bit too hard for the wickets
a big appeal for lbw as Narine bowls the knuckle ball, turned down by the umpire as that was turning down the leg side, probably a bit high as well
shortish ball outside off, Mashrafe sways out of the line

huge lbw appeal, after thinking over it the umpire raises the finger, West Indies were pleading with him before the decision came, Mshrafe has to go, he was hit on the back leg by an offcutter, hit on the thigh pad, was it too high? Mashrafe thinks so, the umpire doesn't, Bangladesh nine down, and another sorry outing for them is coming to a close
shortish ball on the stump, Al-Amin ducks under that one

it's all over, 57 for 3 to 70 all out, that is some collapse even by Bangladeshi standards, and it ends with a farcical run-out, a solid drive towards mid-on by Al-Amin, he thinks it has beaten Simmons at mid-on, but Simmons makes a diving stop, Al-Amin was midway down the pitch when he realised he has to turn back, plenty of time for Simmons to relay the ball to Ramdin, who finishes off the 177-run victory
